str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To suffer previously. From pro and pascho; to undergo hardship previously.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To insult, treat with insolence. From hubris; to exercise violence, i.e. Abuse.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Philippi, a great city of the Roman province Macedonia. Plural of Philippos; Philippi, a place in Macedonia.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Much, many; often.
From ago; properly, a place of assembly, i.e. a contest; figuratively, an effort or anxiety.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To speak freely, boldly; To be confident.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
